thread.title: AP PHOTOS: The rise and fall of Oscar Pistorius
thread.title_full: AP PHOTOS: The rise and fall of Oscar Pistorius - San Francisco Chronicle

author: The Associated Press
title: AP PHOTOS: The rise and fall of Oscar Pistorius
text: Photo: Matt Dunham, AP FILE - In this Saturday, Sept. 8, 2012, file photo, South Africa's gold medalist Oscar Pistorius poses with his medal after winning the men's 400 meters T44 category final during the athletics competition at the 2012 Paralympics, in London. Pistorius’ release from prison to serve the remainder of a five-year manslaughter sentence under house arrest was the latest chapter in the story of a once-inspiring double-amputee runner who made history at the Olympics, and then killed his girlfriend. FILE - In this Saturday, Sept. 8, 2012, file photo, South Africa's... JOHANNESBURG (AP) — Oscar Pistorius' release from prison to serve the remainder of a five-year manslaughter sentence under house arrest is the latest chapter in the story of the once-inspiring double-amputee runner who made history at the Olympics and then killed his girlfriend. FILE - In this Saturday, Sept. 8, 2012, file photo, South Africa's gold medalist Oscar Pistorius poses with his medal after winning the men's 400 meters T44 category final during the athletics competition at the 2012 Paralympics, in London. Pistorius’ release from prison to serve the remainder of a five-year manslaughter sentence under house arrest was the latest chapter in the story of a once-inspiring double-amputee runner who made history at the Olympics, and then killed his girlfriend. FILE - In this Saturday, Sept. 8, 2012, file photo, South Africa's... JOHANNESBURG (AP) — Oscar Pistorius' release from prison to serve the remainder of a five-year manslaughter sentence under house arrest is the latest chapter in the story of the once-inspiring double-amputee runner who made history at the Olympics and then killed his girlfriend.
